channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: McCain: Russian hacks threaten to 'destroy democracy'
Poll: 55% of Americans bothered by Russian hacking
item.description: More than half of Americans say they're bothered by Russian hacks of Democratic emails in an effort to help Donald Trump win the election, a new NBC News/Wall Street Journal poll shows.

item.title: Priebus to intelligence agencies: 'Make the case' on Russian hacking
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's incoming chief of staff continued to cast doubt on the American intelligence community's finding that Russia was responsible for hacks into Democratic emails in an effort to help Trump defeat Hillary Clinton.

item.title: Gates on Tillerson and Russia: 'Being friendly doesn't make you friends'
item.description: Former Defense Secretary Robert Gates defended Sunday President-elect Donald Trump's pick for secretary of state, ExxonMobil CEO Rex Tillerson, over his relationship with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Aleppo evacuations resume after buses set ablaze
Protests grow in Poland as political crisis deepens
item.description: A bitter political crisis in Poland worsened over the weekend with heated protests both in and outside the nation's parliament and a swirl of allegations of attempted coups and threats to democracy.

item.title: Beaches, retreats and former prisons: Island hopping in Vietnam
item.description: When I fled Vietnam as a child, I never imagined that the islands we attempted our escapes from would one day become luxurious beach resorts.

item.title: Indonesian plane crash kills at least 12
item.description: At least 12 people on board an Indonesian military aircraft were killed Sunday morning when the plane crashed into a mountain in the eastern section of the country, the Indonesian military said in a statement.

item.title: Philippine President slams US, says drug war will not stop
item.description: The Philippine President vowed Friday to keep up his controversial campaign against drugs as long as he remains in office.

item.title: Canadian woman among 7 killed in shootout in Jordan
item.description: A Canadian woman is among seven people killed Sunday in Jordan as unknown gunmen fired at police officers at various locations, including an ancient castle popular with tourists.

item.title: What Trump can do for Aleppo
item.description: The US President-elect walks onto the world stage facing a question: Will this century of genocides end or continue?

item.title: US says China will return underwater drone
item.description: China has agreed to return the US underwater drone that it seized in international waters earlier this week, the Pentagon said Saturday.

item.title: Former Gitmo detainee sent back to Uruguay
item.description: Former Guantanamo detainee Jihad Diyab is returning to Uruguay this weekend after being denied entry to South Africa, according to Christian Mirza, a former refugee mediator for the Uruguayan Government.

item.title: Out of Mosul, into limbo: The refugees fleeing ISIS
item.description: Dunya is pale and exhausted.

item.title: Suicide bomber kills more than 40 in Yemen
item.description: A suicide attack in the southern Yemeni city of Aden on Sunday killed at least 41 soldiers and injured others, two Yemeni senior security officials told CNN.

item.title: A brazen Russia must face U.S. retribution
item.description: Trump is free to seek better relations but if Russia has manipulated the US election, it must first face retribution in the cyber arena, Ivan Eland writes

item.title: With Russian meddling, truth is as disturbing as fiction
item.description: Four years ago, I decided to take a stab at writing my first book. I intended it to be fiction. I may have failed.

item.title: Five enduring mysteries about Trump's victory
item.description: When historians look back at the 2016 election, there will likely be many big mysteries to solve.

item.title: How Michelle Obama threw us a lifeline
item.description: The First Lady spoke for many when she told Oprah Winfrey: "we are feeling what not having hope feels like." One hopes she'll be more free to speak out like this in her post-White House life.

item.title: Repealing Obamacare would lower taxes for the rich
item.description: Repealing Obamacare would be a big tax boon for wealthy Americans.

item.title: These are America's biggest trading partners
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has threatened to upend America's trading relationships, especially with China, Mexico and Canada.

item.title: The Cuban baseball smuggling machine
item.description: There's a vast and vicious human trafficking network that supplies Major League Baseball with some of its top players.

item.title: A new perspective of our planet
item.description: On Christmas Eve in 1968, Apollo 8 made the first manned mission to the moon. Live broadcasting from the spacecraft was the three-man crew of Frank Borman, Jim Lovell and William Anders, and it was on that day that their journey led them to an unexpected sight.

item.title: Galaxy count just increased 10x
item.description: Turns out we were wrong; there aren't 200 billion galaxies in the universe.

item.title: Study: Mars mission astronauts could experience brain damage
item.description: Astronauts on a mission to Mars will be expected to rely on their memory, multitasking and decision-making skills to handle the first manned expedition beyond the moon. But the harmful radiation from galactic cosmic rays throughout their journey could cause them to experience cognitive impairment in these key areas, as well as increased depression and anxiety, according to a new study.

item.title: New Mars probe searches for life
item.description: A new phase in the continuing search for life on Mars begins this month -- adding to a fleet of spacecraft probing the Red Planet.

item.title: What it would take to explore deep space
item.description: Imagine something so distant that with our current technology it would take 2,400 generations to reach there -- and that's just our nearest star.

item.title: The world's creepiest underground marvels
item.description: Ever had a tube journey from hell? How about a tube journey into hell -- or out of it, depending on which way you're traveling.

item.title: A 1,650-ft tall ladder made of fire
item.description: Cai Guo-Qiang is back, and with his most ambitious project to date: a 1,650-foot ladder in the sky made of -- what else? -- fire.
